annotation.spannedText: Two doses are given as part of the routine immunisation schedule but it is also important to identify special groups who need immunisation

classMention.mentionClass: Two doses are given as part of the routine immunisation schedule but it is also important to identify special groups who need immunisation

annotation.spannedText: It is also now an important vaccine in the control of outbreaks of measles

classMention.mentionClass: It is also now an important vaccine in the control of outbreaks of measles

annotation.spannedText: MMR and yellow fever vaccines should have a minimum interval of 4 weeks

classMention.mentionClass: MMR and yellow fever vaccines should have a minimum interval of 4 weeks

annotation.spannedText: MMR and varicella (or zoster) vaccines should have a minimum of a 4 week interval if not given on the same day

classMention.mentionClass: MMR and varicella (or zoster) vaccines should have a minimum of a 4 week interval if not given on the same day

annotation.spannedText: MMR should be delayed until the skin test has been read, unless protection against measles is required urgently

classMention.mentionClass: MMR should be delayed until the skin test has been read, unless protection against measles is required urgently

annotation.spannedText: All children should be given the first dose prior to school entry, unless contra-indicated

classMention.mentionClass: All children should be given the first dose prior to school entry, unless contra-indicated

annotation.spannedText: A booster dose should be given between ages 3 years and 4 months to 5 years

classMention.mentionClass: A booster dose should be given between ages 3 years and 4 months to 5 years

annotation.spannedText: If a dose of MMR is given before the child's first birthday, either because of travel to an endemic country or because of a local outbreak, this dose should be ignored and two further doses given at the recommended times

classMention.mentionClass: If a dose of MMR is given before the child's first birthday, either because of travel to an endemic country or because of a local outbreak, this dose should be ignored and two further doses given at the recommended times

annotation.spannedText: If the child is given the second dose less than three months after the first dose and at less than 18 months of age then the routine preschool dose (a third dose) should be given in order to ensure full protection

classMention.mentionClass: If the child is given the second dose less than three months after the first dose and at less than 18 months of age then the routine preschool dose (a third dose) should be given in order to ensure full protection

annotation.spannedText: Premature babies should be immunised after two months, irrespective of prematurity

classMention.mentionClass: Premature babies should be immunised after two months, irrespective of prematurity

annotation.spannedText: Severely immunocompromised patients should not be given the vaccine but it is indicated for patients with mild-to-moderate immunosuppression

classMention.mentionClass: Severely immunocompromised patients should not be given the vaccine but it is indicated for patients with mild-to-moderate immunosuppression

annotation.spannedText: A specialist should be involved in the decision to vaccinate

classMention.mentionClass: A specialist should be involved in the decision to vaccinate

annotation.spannedText: Women of childbearing age who are seronegative for rubella and who are not currently pregnant, should be given the vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Women of childbearing age who are seronegative for rubella and who are not currently pregnant, should be given the vaccine

annotation.spannedText: Healthcare workers - should be given the vaccine for their own benefit and to protect vulnerable unimmunised patients and their own unimmunised partners

classMention.mentionClass: Healthcare workers - should be given the vaccine for their own benefit and to protect vulnerable unimmunised patients and their own unimmunised partners

annotation.spannedText: Unimmunised seronegative postpartum women should be offered the vaccine a few days after delivery

classMention.mentionClass: Unimmunised seronegative postpartum women should be offered the vaccine a few days after delivery

annotation.spannedText: The vaccine should be given to susceptible children aged over 6 months in contact with a case, within three days of exposure

classMention.mentionClass: The vaccine should be given to susceptible children aged over 6 months in contact with a case, within three days of exposure

annotation.spannedText: These children should still have routine MMR at the usual age

classMention.mentionClass: These children should still have routine MMR at the usual age

annotation.spannedText: when in doubt, seek specialist advice

classMention.mentionClass: when in doubt, seek specialist advice

annotation.spannedText: Note that MMR vaccination is not suitable for prophylaxis against mumps or rubella following exposure to either, as the antibody response is too slow

classMention.mentionClass: Note that MMR vaccination is not suitable for prophylaxis against mumps or rubella following exposure to either, as the antibody response is too slow

annotation.spannedText: If immediate protection against measles is required in someone who has recently received a blood product, MMR vaccine should still be given

classMention.mentionClass: If immediate protection against measles is required in someone who has recently received a blood product, MMR vaccine should still be given

annotation.spannedText: To confer longer-term protection, MMR should then be repeated after three months

classMention.mentionClass: To confer longer-term protection, MMR should then be repeated after three months

annotation.spannedText: MMR should ideally be given at the same time as other live vaccines, such as BCG

classMention.mentionClass: MMR should ideally be given at the same time as other live vaccines, such as BCG

annotation.spannedText: There is no evidence that epilepsy occurs more frequently after febrile convulsion caused by MMR than after any other febrile convulsion

classMention.mentionClass: There is no evidence that epilepsy occurs more frequently after febrile convulsion caused by MMR than after any other febrile convulsion

annotation.spannedText: There is overwhelming evidence that there is no link between the MMR vaccine and autism or bowel disease

classMention.mentionClass: There is overwhelming evidence that there is no link between the MMR vaccine and autism or bowel disease
